chapter.2.quest.1.subtitle:
欢迎来到破晓之界。

这个整合包使用自己定制的任务系统，而非传统的FTB任务系统。

这本书会告诉你一些基本信息，帮助你了解即将开始的冒险。

chapter.4.quest.10.subtitle: How to enable vanilla graphics settings menu?
chapter.4.quest.10.task.1.title: Vanilla Graphics Settings
chapter.4.quest.11.description.1:
The mod is used in a different way
    in this pack. Forget that it exists.

   We takes advantage of PMMO's high
 customizability to create special skills
  like Knowledge and set requirements
                    for items.
chapter.4.quest.11.subtitle: Why doesn't ProjectMMO work?
chapter.4.quest.11.task.1.title: ProjectMMO
chapter.4.quest.12.description.1:
Notice the little dot around the edge of the map. That's you. The TOP of the map points to north; The LEFT of the map points to west; etc...
\nThere is sometimes a bug in Vanilla Minecraft where a cross is not shown in the map. In cases like this, you will need to look around the area that the map is located in.
chapter.4.quest.12.subtitle: How do I read an explorer map?
chapter.4.quest.12.task.1.title: Map Reading
chapter.4.quest.13.subtitle: How do I enable commands?
chapter.4.quest.13.task.1.title: Enable Commands
chapter.4.quest.14.description.1:
/gamerule doDCBossesRespawn true

     Note that only players who are
     progressing through the main
  quest-line can re-summon the boss.
chapter.4.quest.14.subtitle: How to enable eye holder bosses' respawn for servers?
chapter.4.quest.14.task.1.title: Enable Boss Respawn
chapter.4.quest.2.description.1:
Press "i" for your last death info
       Press "h" to call your horse
       Press "j" to save your horse
    Press "r" to enable combat mode
     Press "b" to open your backpack \n                 (if equipped)
      Press "n" to open your quiver\n                 (if equipped)
          Press "k" to check and\n            select enabled skills
chapter.4.quest.2.subtitle: A list of keybinds you should know!
chapter.4.quest.2.task.1.title: Useful keybinds to know
chapter.4.quest.3.description.1:
Chronicle of Shadows (Apotheosis)
  Encyclopedia of life (Untamed Wilds)
      Animal Dictionary (Alex's Mobs)
    The Great Butter Book (Lil' Wings)
         Book of Shadows (Hexerei)
       Worn Notebook (Ars Nouveau)
Cloud Storage and You (Cloud Storage)
              Paladin's Furniture
          Food Book (Spice of Life)
chapter.4.quest.3.subtitle: A list of info books you might want. Check in the inventory search bar for their individual crafting recipe!
chapter.4.quest.3.task.1.title: Info Books
chapter.4.quest.4.description.1:
GuildMaster is not a separate entity to villager. Instead, it is a profession, attainable by any villager (except nitwit). \n
The profession block (POI) is the bell commonly found in guild house or stalls. If you find a village with a stall without a guild master, try to wait till noon for villagers to start getting jobs. \n
You could also try to "guide" villagers to the bell, with whatever means possible within the realms of Minecraft.
chapter.4.quest.4.subtitle: Where can you find a guild master?
chapter.4.quest.4.task.1.title: Guild Master
chapter.4.quest.5.description.1:
The information is available in wiki. But one common mistake is that players loot containers that they did not place in front of villagers. This does not only apply to chests within villages. If there is a villager seeing you commit a 'crime' anywhere in the world, your reputation will decrease. 

The maximum amount of bundled currency you'll need to improve your reputation is 8. But that's very unlikely to happen, unless you were to massacre villages. Most of the time 1-2 bundled currencies will be enough.

However, if you feel that your low reputation is misjudged and would like to start out at 0 rep, turn on cheats and do 
/setreputation reputation:villager @p 0

Note that you will ALSO need a trading scroll on TOP of having enough reputation to trade with a villager. A trading scroll can be obtained via completing villager quests.
chapter.4.quest.5.subtitle: Why won't villagers interact with me?
chapter.4.quest.5.task.1.title: Reputation #1
chapter.4.quest.6.description.1:
Trade prices are absurdly high if you have neutral reputation with the villagers.\n
However, finishing just 1-2 side quests alone will most likely significantly reduce the price of trades.
chapter.4.quest.6.subtitle: How to get better trade prices?
chapter.4.quest.6.task.1.title: Reputation #2
chapter.4.quest.7.description.1:
Besides killing pillagers and Goblin King, all the other main quests are detected through the player picking up the ender eyes.
\nSo if you have killed one of the bosses (Eye Holders) beforehand and obtained the eye. All you have to do is drop the eye the Eye Holder held, then pick it up again. With that you should be able to complete the guildmaster's quest.
chapter.4.quest.7.subtitle: How are main quests' completion detected?
chapter.4.quest.7.task.1.title: Quest Detection
chapter.4.quest.8.description.1:
Best Performance:
           - Sildurs Vibrant Lite

      Recommended for Best Visuals:
        - Complimentary Reimagined

         Try others if these don't 
           fit your preferences!
chapter.4.quest.8.subtitle: Which shader should I use?
chapter.4.quest.8.task.1.title: Shader Recommendation
chapter.4.quest.9.description.1:
Look into the mod 'Claim Chunks'. This mod adds a new block - Claim Block into the game. 

Check their CurseForge page to learn how to customize your chunk permissions!

*The max amount of chunks a player could claim is 8 by default.
chapter.4.quest.9.subtitle: How do I protect my properties in a server?
chapter.4.quest.9.task.1.title: Claim Chunks
